flawed_nl_solution:
Sandra had 2 bags that each contained 6 pieces of candy so 2*6 = <<2*6=12>>12 pieces
Roger had 11 pieces of candy in one bag and 3 pieces in the other so 11+3 = <<11+3=13>>13 pieces
Roger had 13 pieces and Sandra had 12 pieces so Roger has 13-12 = <<13-12=1>>1 more pieces of candy
#### 1

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 14, not 13. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
